Name: Painted jar with four suspension handles
Description: This full-bellied vessel has a small base and narrow rim. On the shoulder are four triangular handles in pairs. The upper part of the body is decorated with red paint. The space in between each pair of handles is filled by a tree; the crowns are indicated by lattice and herringbone motifs. Standing triangles, zigzag bands, checkerboard motifs and wavy lines also decorate this vessel, which was made from fine light red clay on a slowly turning wheel.
